data.title: Shenandoah Summer Music Theatre
data.meta_description: To cure his “blues,” a lonely man (played by yours truly) puts on the original cast album of one of his favorite musicals from 1928. data.text:
To cure his “blues,” a lonely man (played by yours truly) puts on the original cast album of one of his favorite musicals from 1928. As he does, the musical springs to life in his apartment. Will Janet marry Robert and quit the biz? Will Adolpho win Janet’s heart before she says “I do?” Will the Chaperone stay sober? Find out in this hilarious love letter to musical comedy. RATED: PG-13

Music and Lyrics by Lisa Lambert and Greg Morrison

Book by Bob Martin and Don McKellar

This production includes the use of theatrical haze, flashing lighting effects, hijinx, and tomfoolery.
